example.title: Declaring a Variable and Using it in an Expression
example.para: We can create a variable named x which holds integer values with the following statement:

Once a variable is declared, you can use it as an expression (called a variable expression). The expression will evaluate to whatever the variable holds. Evaluating the expression x yields the value 0, since 0 is the default value given to a variable of type int. You can see both the declaration statement and the variable expression being evaluted below:
example.screen:
jshell> int x; x ==> 0
jshell> x x ==> 0
example.para: Note that if you use a variable in an expression before its defined, an error will result.
example.screen: jshell> y | Error: | cannot find symbol | symbol: variable y | y | ^
